private_information: I have access to a concrete plan of actions that was proposed for the scene and can check applicability of actions against known facts.
I know the definitions of the available actions including parameter patterns and their preconditions and effects.
actor.goal: Verify and annotate the provided plan steps and produce a compact action model summary that describes preconditions and effects in a structured way.

private_information: I hold a set of initial facts and an alternative variant of initial facts for a related scenario and can reason about reachability from those facts to the stated goals.
I can check which facts are present initially and which facts must be produced or deleted by actions.
observer.goal: Analyze initial facts and the stated goals and produce a concise fact inventory and recommendations for missing connections needed to reach the goal.

private_information: I coordinate information collected from the actor and the observer and must synthesize a complete PDDL domain and problem that is consumable by the FastDownwards planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action models and fact inventories from the other agents and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file targeted to the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Available actions: paltry(obj0,obj1,obj2), sip(obj0,obj1,obj2), clip(obj0,obj1,obj2), wretched(obj0,obj1,obj2,obj3), memory(obj0,obj1,obj2), tightfisted(obj0,obj1,obj2).
Action paltry requires preconditions hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2; effects add next obj0 obj2 and delete vase obj0 obj1.
Action sip requires preconditions hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2; effects add vase obj0 obj1 and delete next obj0 obj2.
Action clip requires preconditions hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2; effects add vase obj0 obj1 and delete next obj0 obj2.

Action wretched requires preconditions sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3; effects add next obj0 obj2 and delete next obj0 obj1.
Action memory requires preconditions cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1; effects add next obj0 obj2 and delete next obj0 obj1.
Action tightfisted requires preconditions hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1; effects add next obj0 obj2 and delete vase obj0 obj1.

Initial facts variant A: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_8, next object_10 object_9, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_8, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.

Initial facts variant B: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_8, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_6, next object_4 object_6, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal variant A: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8.
Goal variant B: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7.
A proposed plan (example) is provided as a sequence of grounded action instances which agents can validate for precondition satisfaction and effect propagation.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert in action modeling and plan validation. Using the public action specifications you should check each step of the provided plan for applicability under the initial facts that the observer holds. Produce a compact structured summary of each action schema listing parameters, formal preconditions and effects and annotate which plan steps appear applicable and which require additional facts.
analyze.prompt: You are the actor agent. Use your private plan access and the public action descriptions to validate the plan steps and produce a structured action model summary and per-step applicability annotations. Do not emit PDDL; produce a clear model summary that the orchestrator can consume.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert in initial state analysis and goal reachability. List the explicit facts present in the provided initial facts variants, highlight which facts are relevant to the goal variant B, and identify any missing support facts that must be produced by actions. Output a concise fact inventory and a dependency list of which action effects are required to achieve each goal atom.
analyze.prompt: You are the observer agent. Analyze the initial facts and the goal variants and provide a fact inventory, relevance mapping to the goals, and recommendations for missing connectors. Do not emit PDDL; produce a concise machine-friendly summary the orchestrator can integrate.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and must integrate models and inventories from other agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards planner. Ensure the domain encodes all provided action schemas with distinct action names per agent if needed and the problem encodes the objects, the chosen initial facts (use variant B), and the goal variant B. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Include a short 'requirements :strips :typing' header appropriate for FastDownwards and ensure types and predicate declarations are consistent.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator agent. Integrate the actor model: {model_actor} and the observer inventory: {model_observer}. Use initial facts variant B and target goal variant B. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem>. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure predicates and objects match the facts inventory.
